column1: Male patient, 56 years old, who came to the DEA for fever and dyspnoea for a few days, being treated with Klacid and tachipirine without benefit.
Remote pathological history changes; near pathological anamnesis: arterial hypertension under treatment.
Arrives in severe general clinical conditions, alert and cooperating alert, tachypnoic at rest, TC 37.1 Â° C.
Oxygen saturation 90; lymphopenia, high PCR; remaining laboratory tests in the standard.
computed/computerized tomography scan of the chest is performed without intravenous administration of contrast medium.
Axial images, Lung algorithm reconstruction, medium scan
Multiple pseudo-nodular thickenings of para-centimetric dimensions.

Multiple confluent parenchymal thickenings, with emery glass density at the level of both lungs, with a predominantly subpleural distribution, with thickening of the inter-lobular and intra-lobular septa.
Multiple areas of parenchymal thickening with frosted glass density involving both lungs.
